page.title: 07Glastonbury -New shops
page.content: Many of the townspeople are dissatis- fied with the quality of the shops in Glastonbury. Too many shops appear to be geared to the tourist trade, expensive dress shops and others with a strong bias towards the occult and mystical aspects of the town. A petit- ion has been circulated for a new supermarket. It was pointed out that at present there is only one, and with two other small private grocery stores there is generally little competition -resulting in possibly higher prices. A ten year old child pointed out that at present it is a hard climb to the top of the town for an elderly person living in Benedict Street or Paradise Estate. The existing supermarket has poor parking facilities and it is felt that there should be a greater and cheaper range of shopping facilities.
